com.xorprogramming.io.utils

Class StringIOUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.xorprogramming.io.utils.StringIOUtils

  • public final class StringIOUtils
extends Object
    A utility class containing convenient methods for reading and writing a String.
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Steven Roberts

    • Method Detail

      • readFromAssets

        public static String readFromAssets(AssetManager assets,
                    String file)
                             throws IOException
        Reads the content of a file in the assets directory.
        Parameters:
        assets - The assets to open
        file - The name of the asset to open. This name can be hierarchical
        Returns:
        The content of the file
        Throws:
        IOException - If an error occurs while reading from the stream
        See Also:
        AssetManager.open(String)

      • readFromInternalStorage

        public static String readFromInternalStorage(Context c,
                             String file)
                                      throws IOException
        Reads the content of a file in internal storage
        Parameters:
        c - The context with which to open file input
        file - The name of the file to open; can not contain path separators
        Returns:
        The content of the file
        Throws:
        IOException - If an error occurs while reading from the stream
        See Also:
        Context.openFileInput(String)

                   String file)
                            throws IOException
        Reads the content of a file in the cache directory
        Parameters:
        c - The context with which to open cache input
        file - The path of the file to open relative to the cache directory
        Returns:
        The content of the file
        Throws:
        IOException - If an error occurs while reading from the stream
        See Also:
        Context.getCacheDir()

        Reads the content of an InputStream
        Parameters:
        is - The name of the asset to open. This name can be hierarchical
        Returns:
        The content of the file

      • writeToInternalStorage

        public static void writeToInternalStorage(Context c,
                          String file,
                          int mode,
                          String out)
                                   throws IOException
        Writes a String to the internal storage associated with the context.
        Parameters:
        c - The context with which to open file output
        out - The object to save
        file - The name of the file to open; can not contain path separators.
        mode - Operating mode. Use 0 or Context.MODE_PRIVATE for the default operation, MODE_APPEND to append to an existing file, Context.MODE_WORLD_READABLE and Context.MODE_WORLD_WRITEABLE to control permissions.
        Throws:
        IOException - If an error occurs while writing to the stream
        See Also:
        Context.openFileOutput(String, int)

      • writeToCache

        public static void writeToCache(Context c,
                String file,
                String out)
                         throws IOException
        Writes a String to the cache directory of the filesystem.
        Parameters:
        c - The context with which to open cache output
        out - The object to save
        file - The path of the file to open relative to the cache directory
        Throws:
        IOException - If an error occurs while writing to the stream
        See Also:
        Context.getCacheDir()

      • writeToExternalStorage

        public static void writeToExternalStorage(String file,
                          String out)
                                   throws IOException
        Writes a String to the primary external storage directory.
        Parameters:
        out - The object to save
        file - The path of the file to open relative to the external storage directory
        Throws:
        IOException - If an error occurs while writing to the stream
        See Also:
        Environment.getExternalStorageDirectory()
